title: Meralgia Paresthetica Treatment
content: Meralgia paresthetica involves compression of the lateral femoral cutaneous nerve, causing anterolateral thigh numbness and paresthesia. Management addresses contributory factors including tight clothing, obesity, and pregnancy. Weight loss, clothing modification, and NSAIDs are first-line treatments. Local anesthetic or corticosteroid injection may provide temporary relief. Surgical neurolysis is considered only for severe, persistent cases.
